projects.title: Cars v1
projects.category: A project for the Web Development Essentials section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description:
The assignment for this project was to designed to teach object-oriented programming.

My solution is a simple page that shows various car models and shows the description of the car when clicked.

projects.title: Restaurant POS
projects.category: A project for the Web Development Essentials section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was to create an ordering system that would be used by wait staff to submit orders to the bar and kitchen.

projects.title: Guitarist Center v2
projects.category: A capstone project for the Web Development Essentials section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was to make an online store with a functional shopping cart and a checkout process that offers the ability to use a discount code.
projects.technology: sessionStorage for shopping cart persistence, Bootstrap 4, HTML, and JavaScript.

projects.title: React Resume
projects.category: A project for the React / Express section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was to make an online resume using ReactJS.

projects.title: Guitarist Center v3
projects.category: A project for the React / Express section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was designed to teach ReactJS events.
projects.technology: localStorage for shopping cart persistence, ReactJS, React Bootstrap, jQuery, and jQueryUI

projects.title: Calculator
projects.category: A project for the React / Express section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was designed to teach ReactJS events by making a calculator.

projects.title: To-do List v1
projects.category: A project for the React / Express section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was designed to teach ReactJS events by making a to-do list that allows the user to add / delete items from a list and has admin users that can see other users' lists.

projects.title: Currency Converter / Three Card Monte
projects.category: A project for the React / Express section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description:
The assignment for this project was to create an app that allows the user to choose between two functions – a currency converter and a Three-card Monte game.

The currency converter fetches the current exchange rates from https://apilayer.com/ in order to convert currency between US Dollars, Euros, Pounds Sterling, and South African Rands.

The Three-Card Monte game is a simple game of chance that gives feedback about the winning or losing streak.

projects.title: Connect Four
projects.category: A capstone project for the React / Express section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was to create a simple game (other than Tic-Tac-Toe) using React.

projects.title: Current Weather
projects.category: A project for the React / Express section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was to create a ReactJS app that will display the weather in a city of the user’s choice. The user should be able to enter or select the name of the city that they would like to see the weather for. The app should get the weather by fetching the OpenWeatherMap API: https://openweathermap.org/current.

projects.title: Cars v2
projects.category: A project for the Full Stack section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was to create a full stack web application (create the back-end of the application using Express and the front-end using React). The data is stored in a MongoDB that stores information about cars in a collection called cars.
projects.technology: ExpressJS, MongoDB (Mongoose), NodeJS, ReactJS, and React Bootstrap

projects.title: To-do List v2 (with Login)
projects.category: A project for the Full Stack section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was to build upon the previous to-do application by adding a login and writing the to-do items to MongoDB.
projects.technology: ExpressJS, MongoDB (Mongoose), NodeJS, ReactJS, React Bootstrap, and React Simple Storage

projects.title: Using an API
projects.category: A project for the Full Stack section of the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp I completed.
projects.description: The assignment for this project was to use NextJS to build a dynamic website that uses data retrieved from an API.
